entry.title: Southern chivalry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that American abolitionists co-opted the concept of Southern chivalry (caricature pictured) as an insult against pro-slavery white Southerners?

entry.title: Shagdarjavin Natsagdorj (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shagdarjavin Natsagdorj's remarks at an academic conference led to a communist purge and contributed to the Sino-Soviet split?

entry.title: Pujol (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Pujol and Quintonil are the highest-rated restaurants in Mexico's first Michelin guide, with two Michelin stars each?

entry.title: Peter Bowden (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that football player Peter Bowden only started long snapping to help his cousin, a punter, produce film in high school, and both are now in the National Football League?

entry.title: Jennings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the adjacent Jennings and Sloane Houses comprise New York City's largest single-family residence?

entry.title: Arthur Fulton (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Arthur Fulton was a sniper in the First World War and described as "the most famous rifle shot the world has ever known"?

entry.title: Asyikin–Brugman Treaty (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Asyikin–Brugman Treaty was revoked 11 days after being signed?

entry.title: Shirley Warde (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shirley Warde not only starred in theater and movie productions, but also wrote playscripts and short stories for magazines?

entry.title: a procession to ask for rain (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in Thailand and Cambodia, cats are used in a procession to ask for rain?

entry.title: Bonn (Wikivoyage recommendations)
entry.content:
Bonn

Destination of the Month

Founded by the Romans, the former West German capital was also the home of Beethoven and its lively streets has given it the nickname "Italy's most northern city ".

entry.title: North West River (Wikivoyage recommendations)
entry.content:
North West River

Off the Beaten Path

Visit Central Labrador's oldest European settlement and the northeasternmost town on the North American road network for some lakeside scenery and to learn about the culture of the Innu, Inuit, Metis and the European settlers of Labrador.

entry.title: E8 through Finland and Norway (Wikivoyage recommendations)
entry.content:
E8 through Finland and Norway

Featured Travel Topic

From Turku to Tromsø, European route E8 passes through various types of Finnish and Norwegian landscapes.

entry.content:
13 June 2024
The Interplay Between Cap Rates and Interest Rates
By Charles De Andrade, CAIA and Soren Godbersen

What is the relationship between cap rates and interest rates? It's not as straightforward as you may think.

entry.title: Still Misperceived? A Fresh Look at Bitcoin Volatility (CFA Institute Daily Browse)
entry.content:
12 June 2024
Still Misperceived? A Fresh Look at Bitcoin Volatility
By Andrew Keenan, CFA, CAIA, FDP and Vibhu Gomatam

Is Bitcoin considerably more volatile than other asset classes? It's important to approach this question analytically and with an open mind because perceptions do not always match reality.

entry.title: FX Bubbles: Through the Lens of Shiller and Sornette (CFA Institute Daily Browse)
entry.content:
11 June 2024
FX Bubbles: Through the Lens of Shiller and Sornette
By Sebastian Petric, CFA and Ming Deng, PhD

The theories and models introduced by Robert Shiller and Didier Sornette are as applicable to the foreign exchange market as they are to the stock market.

entry.title: Book Review: A Wealth of Well-Being (CFA Institute Daily Browse)
entry.content:
07 June 2024
Book Review: A Wealth of Well-Being
By Mark K. Bhasin, CFA

Finance practitioners can benefit from Meir Statman's challenge to make finance an “afterthought” and spend more time thinking about life well-being.

entry.title: What’s Your Client’s Optimal Equity Allocation? (CFA Institute Daily Browse)
entry.content:
06 June 2024
What’s Your Client’s Optimal Equity Allocation?
By David Blanchett, PhD, CFA, CFP and Jeremy Stempien

Note to investment advisors: You may be overestimating the risks of equities for conservative investors with longer investment horizons.

entry.title: Gold and Inflation: An Unstable Relationship (CFA Institute Daily Browse)
entry.content:
05 June 2024
Gold and Inflation: An Unstable Relationship
By Marc Fandetti, CFA

While there are periods when gold has hedged inflation quite well, beware blanket claims of gold's inflation-hedging utility.

entry.content:
04 June 2024
Net-Zero Hour
By Paul Andrews

CFA Institute is contributing to the net-zero discussion with the aim to bring clarity around certain issues impacting investors.

entry.title: Monetary Policy and Financial Conditions: Meaningful Relationship? (CFA Institute Daily Browse)
entry.content:
03 June 2024
Monetary Policy and Financial Conditions: Meaningful Relationship?
By Jordan Doyle

An analysis of the Fed's recent rounds of quantitative tightening (QT) and quantitative easing (QE) yields actionable insights about the relationship between monetary policy and financial conditions.

entry.title: Climate Data in the Investment Process: Challenges, Resources, and Considerations (CFA Institute Daily Browse)
entry.content:
31 May 2024
Climate Data in the Investment Process: Challenges, Resources, and Considerations
By Deborah Kidd, CFA

Investors should not be deterred from using climate-related data, despite its imperfections. Instead, they should understand the data’s risks and limitations and apply judgment to make effective use of it. Investors can help improve the current state of climate-related data by encouraging issuers to adopt global disclosure standards and advocating for disclosure regulations.

entry.title: Five Quotes from Financial History to Guide Trustees (CFA Institute Daily Browse)
entry.content:
31 May 2024
Five Quotes from Financial History to Guide Trustees
By Mark J. Higgins, CFA, CFP

If you serve as a trustee of an institutional investment plan, these five quotes may help guide your decisions for the benefit of those who depend on your stewardship.
